hypothesis_content.title: Low Liquidity Regime Reversal on Volume Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: In the current low liquidity regime (post-October 'crash'), the first significant volume spike (>2.5x 30-day average) on a neutral-to-bearish price candle will lead to a sharp, short-term mean reversion rally as trapped liquidity is forced to cover.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Thin order books in low liquidity environments exaggerate price moves. A high-volume sell-off likely exhausts immediate sellers, creating a vacuum that prompts a rapid bounce as market makers and shorts cover.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour volume > 2.5x its 30-day average for that hour-of-day
Price on high-volume candle closes in bottom 30% of its range (selling climax pattern)
Aggregated exchange order book shows bid depth increasing within 15 minutes of spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry OR BTC retraces 61.8% of the prior 24-hour decline
exit_conditions.stop_loss: New 4-hour low below the volume spike candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If high-volume decline is followed by continued selling on similar or increasing volume, indicating genuine distribution, not exhaustion.
